reviews.text: Can't complain about the station itself. There's adequate seating and it's always clean and quiet. Merseyrail on the other hand are absolutely awful. The timings on trains going to the Ellesmere Port stations are terrible. Would be alright if the all the Chester trains stopped at Capenhurst but they only do every second one at around the same time as the train stops at the Port so we have two trains every half hour going to the Port but they're both at the same time.

Another reviewer complaining about terrible staff: Overpool is an unmanned station so there are no staff at all until a train arrives, so I don't know what they're going on about.

There is one thing people come to overpool for: getting on a train. And you can do that just fine.

A very rudimentary station, with a single ticket machine on the westbound access ramp and small brick waiting shelters with windowless openings. Fairly gentle ramps suitable for wheelchairs, if a bit of a pull in the upwards direction. Definitely needs some improvement. No car park, though plenty of space on nearby streets.
What a dump full of kids just sitting off
